abbreviations directions for sweater work the following set-up round bor m will be at the center back folded collar k15 16 16 18 19 20 20 20 sts back pm k10 10 10 8 6 6 6 6 sts sleeve pm k30 32 32 36 38 using waste yarn and with ribbing needle co 80 84 40 40 40 sts front pm k10 10 10 8 6 6 6 6 sts 84 88 88 92 92 92 sts using the provisional cast on sleeve pm k15 16 16 18 19 20 20 20 sts back method of your choice place bor m and join to work in the round note see pattern notes for a contrast color on change to gauge needle the inside collar now work gsr while also increasing at the raglans as ribbing round *k3 p1 repeat from * to end work in rib pat- follows tern as est until piece measures 4 / 10cm from co gsr 1 knit to 1 st before first raglan marker m1r k1 sm fold collar in half and knit live sts on the needle together k1 m1l knit across sleeve sts until 1 st before next marker with the sts from the provisional co do this by inserting m1r k1 sm k1 m1l k2 turn work 4 sts increase d the left hand needle through 1 purl bump from the provi- sional co and knitting this purl bump together with 1 st gsr 2 gsr purl to bor m slipping the raglan markers as from the left hand needle k2tog pick up next purl bump you come to them purl to 1 st before raglan marker m1rp with left hand needle from provisional cast on and knit this p1 sm p1 m1lp purl across sleeve sts until 1 st before purl bump together with 1st from left hand needle k2tog next raglan marker m1rp p1 sm p1 m1lp p2 turn repeat this process for the entire round work 4 sts increase d at this point you may unravel your waste yarn from the gsr
